items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 128 supports the Promise.try() static method. See the relevant ChromeStatus entry and the explainer.

The BCD tests did not accept the proposal URL as the spec URL, so I have put it as "standard_track": false for now.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add Promise.try() static method

items.content_html:
This was most recently researched and updated here:
#18917
#21569

These two tests were run in Chrome 88, 89, Edge 18, and Safari 17.5:
https://codepen.io/estelle/pen/rNZNqaK
https://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?saved=12923

The filter works in Chrome 89, but not in Chrome 88, Edge 18, or Safari
17.5.

Chrome 89 is confirmed by these additional sources:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32567156/why-dont-css-filters-work-on-svg-elements-in-chrome
https://crbug.com/40134524#comment79

Lack of support in Safari is confirmed by these sources:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76919922/css-filters-on-svg-elements-not-applied-in-safari
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=246106

The WebKit bug is linked.
items.title: Correct data for CSS filter on SVG elements

items.content_html:
This was implemented in WebKit 535.8:
WebKit/WebKit@78f8706
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/78f87065d871ddf0bb9d4c77310f62ae6375df47/Source/WebCore/Configurations/Version.xcconfig

That maps to Chrome 17 and Safari 6.

The commit message mentions support in IE10, which is confirmed by this
proposal from the time:
https://www.w3.org/html/wg/wiki/ChangeProposals/sandbox_allow_popups

Thus it must have been in Edge 12 as well.
items.title: Update browser versions for sandbox="allow-popups"

items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 128 supports the calc-size() function and interpolate-size property. See the relevant ChromeStatus entry for more information.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add calc-size() function and interpolate-size property

items.content_html:
This was implemented in WebKit 537.6:
WebKit/WebKit@73c18e6
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/73c18e62d7b18a7ad8c626be054f7a3845e53506/Source/WebCore/Configurations/Version.xcconfig

That maps to Chrome 23 and Safari 7.

Those versions need to be clamped to support for requestPointerLock(),
which is Chrome 22 and Safari 10.1. Pointer lock isn't supported on iOS.

All in all: Chrome 23 and Safari 10.1.
items.title: Update Chrome/Safari versions for sandbox="allow-pointer-lock"

items.content_html:
This was implemented without a flag, and with the reflected IDL
attribute, in WebKit 532.6:
WebKit/WebKit@c205c4e
https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/c205c4e7d40da38c5009df548c2316a358a4fca7/WebCore/Configurations/Version.xcconfig

That maps to Chrome 5 + Safari 5 + iOS 4, which also matches exactly
earlier updates based on collector test results:
#7243
#7290
#7402

The handled attribute tokens were "allow-same-origin", "allow-forms",
and "allow-scripts", so update that data to match.

The "allow-popups" entry was bumped to pass the lint.
items.title: Update initial support for <iframe sandbox> in WebKit

items.content_html: See openwebdocs/mdn-bcd-collector#1677 (apparently this is in the custom IDL in the OWD collector but I can't find it in specs or in browsers, so we should remove this)
items.title: Remove CSSStyleDeclaration.@@iterator

items.content_html: See mdn/content#34856
items.title: Remove obsolete api.CanvasRenderingContext2D.scrollPathIntoView

items.content_html:
Safari's A >> B syntax is gone for a long time and for Chrome, it looks like A >>> B is gone, too.
See https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/HX5Y8Ykr5Ns/m/2R_xIkOvCgAJ
items.title: Remove >> and >>> descendant syntax

items.content_html:
This PR removes the battery member of the Permissions-Policy HTTP header from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.12.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/http/headers/Permissions-Policy/battery
items.title: Remove http.headers.Permissions-Policy.battery from BCD

items.content_html:
FF129 Adds support for using MediaCapabilities.decodingInfo() with encoded media in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1898344

The spec is a bit messy, but what it means is that

  • you have a new property to the configuration object passed to that method called keySystemConfiguration.
  • The returned promise resolves to include the property keySystemAccess which is a MediaKeySystemAccess you can use to get keys and decode the content for playback.

What I have done is added a subfeature under decodingInfo() for the keySystemConfiguration parameter. I haven't added another subfeature for the keySystemAccess in the returned object - should I add that too, even though it would be identical?

Or is to have just one entry but name it encrypted_media?

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#34696

Note: The spec has another value configuration in the return object, but that is not implemented by anyone.
items.title: FF129 MediaCapabilities.decodingInfo() - encrypted content

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the api member of the webextensions Web Extensions interface. This sets the feature(s) to a version range based upon the date that the feature was added to BCD with the intent of replacing true values with ranged values to eliminate true values from BCD.

Commit/PR Adding the Feature: #166

This is a cherry-pick of the files containing more complicated changes that were originally in #23450. While most of the features are set to ≤58, some were set to different version numbers to satisfy the consistency linter, or there was other readily available information already in BCD to confirm the earlier version number.
items.title: Update slightly complex Chromium data for webextensions.api

items.content_html:
The output of the update-browser-releases script is:

@mdn/browser-compat-data@5.5.40 update-browser-releases
node --loader=ts-node/esm --no-warnings=ExperimentalWarning scripts/update-browser-releases/index.ts --all

Updates for Chrome for Desktop

Release note not found for 127.

  • New status for chrome 127: current, previously beta.
  • New status for chrome 128: beta, previously nightly.
  • New status for chrome 126: retired, previously current.

Updates for Chrome for Android

Release note not found for 127.

  • New status for chrome_android 127: current, previously beta.
  • New status for chrome_android 128: beta, previously nightly.
  • New status for chrome_android 126: retired, previously current.

Updates for Webview for Android

Release note not found for 127.

  • New status for webview_android 127: current, previously beta.
  • New status for webview_android 128: beta, previously nightly.
  • New status for webview_android 126: retired, previously current.

Updates for Firefox for Desktop

  • New status for firefox 115: retired, previously esr.
  • New status for firefox 128: esr, previously current.

Updates for Firefox for Android

  • New status for firefox_android 115: retired, previously esr.
  • New status for firefox_android 128: esr, previously current.

Updates for Safari for Desktop

  • New status for safari 17.5: retired, previously current.
  • New status for safari 17.6: current, previously beta.

Updates for Safari for iOS

  • New status for safari_ios 17.5: retired, previously current.
  • New status for safari_ios 17.6: current, previously beta.
items.title: Update browser releases

items.content_html: This PR adds WKWebView to BCD, which fixes #23296. The data will be set to mirror for all features at first, which will occur in a follow-up PR.
items.title: Add WKWebView to BCD

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Safari for the getContext.webgpu_context member of the OffscreenCanvas API. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.11.0).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/OffscreenCanvas/getContext/webgpu_context
items.title: Update Firefox/Safari data for api.OffscreenCanvas.getContext.webgpu_context
